titleStmt.title: Remembrances for the Lords Commissioners Concerning the Demands of the Scots

publicationStmt.publisher: Manuscript Pamphleteering in Early Stuart England (MPESE)

body.p:
Octobr. 13.
anno 1640.
Remembrances for the Lords Commissioners, to put them
in mind of such things, as haue falne into Debate,
about the Demands of the Scotts for maintenance of their
Army during the Treaty.

list.item: The 1st thing they are to endeavor, is, a present cessation of Armes

They are by all Honorable, safe, & convenient means to find out
some wayes for preserving the Counties of Northumber, & the Bishop
=prick of Durham, from the hard condition in which they now are in

For the better effecting heerof, they are to consider how Bar-
wick, & Carlile may be victualled out of Scotland, & the army
of New-Castle in proportion be victualled out of England.

They are also for this purpose to take into consideration the
opening of the free passage, & trade betweene Scotland, & New
castle, by land, & sea, wherby the army ther may be better victu-
alled from Scotland.

If besides the former meanes ther be urgent necessity, they are to
take into consideration what other adiacent Counties shall contri-
bute, & in what proportion, & manner.

They are to remember the great detriment his Majestye hath sustained
in his revenues by hindering the trade of Coales, & to make
what use they can therof for lessening the contribution.
They are to take into consideration the Lessening of both Armies.

They are furder to take care, that upon lessening, or disbanding
of the Army, or otherwise, ther be no plundering of the Coun-
tries, & that security be given for the same.

They are by all possible meanes to hasten the treaty, & that ther
be noe unnecessary delayes therin.

For the better encouragement of such counties, as the Lords shall think
fitt to moue to a contribution, they are to declare unto them, that his
Majesty, & his Lords of the great Councell will recommend to the Parliament,
as well the great losses they haue sustained, as the charge they haue,
or shalbe at, for the good, & safety of the rest of the Kingdome.

body.p:
These remembrances not to be concluding, but any other
way to be taken, that the Commissioners shall thinke fitt.
